text: The Tempest, also known as The Tempest (Prospero and Miranda), or simply Prospero and Miranda, is an outdoor bronze sculpture depicting Prospero and Miranda from William Shakespeare's The Tempest by Milton Hebald, installed outside Delacorte Theater in Manhattan's Central Park, in the U.S. state of New York. The work, which was gifted by George T. Delacorte, Jr. and unveiled in 1966, is a companion piece to Romeo and Juliet (1977). ==See also== * 1966 in art ==References== Category:1966 establishments in New York (state) Category:1966 sculptures Category:Bronze sculptures in Central Park Category:Outdoor sculptures in Manhattan Category:Sculptures in Central Park Category:Sculptures of men in New York City Category:Sculptures of women in New York City Category:Statues in New York City Category:Statues of fictional characters Category:Works based on The Tempest
title: The Tempest (Hebald)
